senses.de: The state or condition of not meeting a desirable or intended objective
senses.ex: The project was a failure because it did not achieve its goals

Tips.title: Negative Connotation
Tips.description: The word often implies disappointment and can be emotionally charged.
Tips.example: Despite their efforts, not reaching the quarterly targets was seen as a failure.

Tips.title: Failure as Learning
Tips.description: Sometimes used positively in educational or motivational contexts to encourage growth.
Tips.example: Each failure in the experiment brought us closer to the correct hypothesis.

Tips.title: Not Always Personal
Tips.description: Can refer to an abstract outcome, not just personal or team efforts.
Tips.example: The failure of the treaty to bring peace was unfortunate.

senses.de: A person who does not succeed
senses.ex: In his own eyes, he was a failure because he did not live up to his own expectations

Tips.title: Subjective Perception
Tips.description: Describes a person's lack of success based on personal or societal standards.
Tips.example: He felt like a failure for not getting the promotion.

Tips.title: Avoid Offense
Tips.description: Calling someone a failure can be very hurtful and is best avoided in polite conversation.
Tips.example: It's rude to label someone a failure for making a mistake.

senses.de: An event that does not accomplish its intended purpose
senses.ex: The planned concert was a failure due to the bad weather

Tips.title: Event-Oriented
Tips.description: Refers specifically to occasions or efforts that did not proceed as planned.
Tips.example: The launch was a failure due to technical glitches.

Tips.title: Impersonal Outcome
Tips.description: Emphasizes on the event, not assigning blame to individuals.
Tips.example: The failure of the peace talks wasn't any one diplomat's fault.

senses.de: The inability of a system or machine to perform its function
senses.ex: The failure of the engine was due to poor maintenance

Tips.title: Technical Specificity
Tips.description: Used in technical contexts to describe malfunctioning equipment or systems.
Tips.example: The flight was delayed due to an engine failure.

Tips.title: Impartial Term
Tips.description: In technical use, implies no fault; a factual statement about function.
Tips.example: Data loss resulted from a sudden network failure.

Defeat.wordDefinition:
Defeat means losing in a competition or a battle after putting up a fight, while failure means not achieving a desired outcome or goal.

Defeat is applicable in a situation where there is a clear winner and loser, such as in a sports game or a war.

Defeat is losing after trying while failure is not succeeding at all.

Disappoint.wordDefinition:
Disappoint means you didn't meet someone's expectations. For example, if you promised to bring someone a gift and then forgot, they might be disappointed.

Disappoint is usually used when someone else is involved and their expectations weren't met, while failure is when you didn't meet your own goals or expectations.

Disaster.wordDefinition:
Disaster describes a sudden and catastrophic event that causes a lot of damage, destruction or loss of life.

Examples of disasters could be earthquakes, floods, hurricanes, or even a plane crash.

A disaster is an event that causes widespread harm.

A disaster is an unexpected and overwhelming event that causes harm, while a failure is the result of not achieving a goal or expectation.

Fiasco.wordDefinition:
Fiasco refers to a complete and total disaster or failure.

It is used in situations where things went extremely wrong and the outcome was much worse than expected. For instance, if an event was poorly planned and executed, resulting in chaos and disruption, it could be called a fiasco.

Failure refers to not achieving a desired outcome, while fiasco describes a complete disaster or failure.

Fizzle.wordDefinition:
Fizzle means that something started off with a lot of excitement or anticipation, but ended up being disappointing because it didn't meet expectations.

For example, if you were looking forward to a big party, but it turned out to be really boring and uneventful, you could say that the party fizzled.

Failure implies that something was attempted and didn't succeed, while fizzle suggests that something fell short of expectations, whether or not there was a specific attempt or goal in mind.

Flop.wordDefinition:
Both failure and flop refer to something that did not succeed, but there is a slight difference between them.

Flop usually refers to something that was expected to be successful, but wasn't. For example, if a new movie comes out and it does not do well at the box office despite being highly anticipated, it is called a flop.

Flop emphasizes that something did not live up to expectations.

Failure emphasizes the lack of success despite effort, while flop emphasizes the failure to meet expectations.

Loss.wordDefinition:
Loss refers to the state of no longer possessing something or someone, often due to circumstances beyond one's control.

For example, someone may experience a loss if they lose a loved one or a valuable possession, such as a home or a job.

Failure is often related to personal achievement or success, while loss is related to material possessions or relationships.

Setback.wordDefinition:
A setback refers to a temporary obstacle or challenge that slows down or delays progress towards a goal.

A failure is when you don't achieve what you set out to do, while a setback is a temporary delay or obstacle that can be addressed or overcome.

quotes.Text: Any fact facing us is not as important as our attitude toward it, for that determines our success or failure. The way you think about a fact may defeat you before you ever do anything about it. You are overcome by the fact because you think you are.
quotes.Title: American Clergyman
quotes.Name: Norman Vincent Peale

quotes.Text: Remember your dreams and fight for them. You must know what you want from life. There is just one thing that makes your dream become impossible: the fear of failure.
quotes.Title: Brazilian Novelist
quotes.Name: Paulo Coelho

quotes.Text: We will all fail in life, but nobody has to be a failure. Failing at a thing doesn't make you a failure. You are only a failure when you quit trying.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Joyce Meyer

quotes.Text: Think twice before you speak, because your words and influence will plant the seed of either success or failure in the mind of another.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Napoleon Hill

quotes.Text: Many of life's failures are people who did not realize how close they were to success when they gave up.
quotes.Title: American Inventor
quotes.Name: Thomas A. Edison

quotes.Text: There is only one failure in life possible, and that is not to be true to the best one knows.
quotes.Title: British Author
quotes.Name: George Eliot

quotes.Text: My fault, my failure, is not in the passions I have, but in my lack of control of them.
quotes.Title: American Novelist
quotes.Name: Jack Kerouac

quotes.Text: In America, there's a failure to appreciate Europe's leading role in the world.
quotes.Title: American President
quotes.Name: Barack Obama

quotes.Text: The only real failure in life is not to be true to the best one knows.
quotes.Title: Leader
quotes.Name: Buddha

quotes.Text: The only real failure in life is one not learned from.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Anthony J. D'Angelo
